To be clear, I like my coworkers
But I draw the line at them changing store hours such that people working on 2nd shift have to stay 1 - 1.5 hours later than is normal
Going from manning the store solo for 3 hours up from 1 hour (not counting half hour of closing)
And basically telling us to suck it up and not giving us a choice
yeah, places have a way of changing the terms of the job and say do or quit
here's an example of why I take huge issue with the changes
Last week, and this week, I swapped every shift I was scheduled for with a coworker, so she has the 3 - 9 shift, and I have the 5 - 12:30 shift (next week 6 - 12:30)
She's a single mother and currently is living with her mother and has a small child (5 - 6yo boy)
She's started going back to school and needed to switch from first to 2nd shift to do it
When the store hours changed with less than a week's notice, she was stuck with the closer for all 5 shifts
the number of times I reminded McD's that I couldn't close Friday and open Saturday... there was less than 6 hours between
The problem is, she lives an hour away and if she holds the shift, by the time she'd get home at around 1:30 - 2, her mother would be leaving for work
This opens up the potential for her child to be home alone, not even considering any huge delays
Manager's response? "The company needs" and "you should make arrangements"
I like my manager, but jesus fucking christ man
Read the room
As such, there's only one such recourse, and I'm not a fan of it because it'll probably dick over my coworkers
